name: Ambient Music Network
description: The origins and development of ambient music, centered on Brian Eno's 1978 coining of the term. Traces the convergent influences from Erik Satie's furniture music, John Cage's environmental sound philosophy, German kosmische musik, French musique concrète, American minimalism, Jamaican dub production techniques, and Japanese kankyō ongaku—through to the Second Generation crystallization in the early 1990s.
author: HistoryNet Contributors

temporalScope.note: From Erik Satie's birth through the Second Generation ambient revival

customRelationshipTypes.description: Source produced recordings or works for target
Source invented or created the target (instrument, technique)

changes: Added Second Generation (1990-1995): Aphex Twin, The Orb, The KLF
Added connectivity fix for Maurice Martenot via Jeanne Loriod
Added Morton Subotnick (West Coast scene, SFTMC co-founder)
Added Holger Czukay (Stockhausen student, Can co-founder)
Expanded Japanese ambient: Midori Takada, Satoshi Ashikawa
